Exaggerate: The claim overstates the number of gun-related deaths by stating that 500 people die from gun violence every day, while the actual average is lower according to the CDC and other anti-gun violence groups.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific data or sources to back up the claim of 500 deaths per day.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of gun-related deaths is consistently 500 per day, which is contradicted by available data.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
